retraction_combing.resolve: 'noskin' if 'noskin' in extruderValues('retraction_combing') else ('infill' if 'infill' in extruderValues('retraction_combing') else ('all' if 'all' in extruderValues('retraction_combing') else ('no_outer_surfaces' if 'no_outer_surfaces' in extruderValues('retraction_combing') else 'off')))

retraction_combing_max_distance.label: Max Comb Distance With No Retract
retraction_combing_max_distance.description: When greater than zero, combing travel moves that are longer than this distance will use retraction. If set to zero, there is no maximum and combing moves will not use retraction.

retraction_combing_avoid_distance.label: Inside Travel Avoid Distance
retraction_combing_avoid_distance.description: The distance between the nozzle and already printed outer walls when travelling inside a model.

travel_retract_before_outer_wall.label: Retract Before Outer Wall
travel_retract_before_outer_wall.description: Always retract when moving to start an outer wall.

travel_avoid_other_parts.label: Avoid Printed Parts When Traveling
travel_avoid_other_parts.description: The nozzle avoids already printed parts when traveling. This option is only available when combing is enabled.

travel_avoid_supports.label: Avoid Supports When Traveling
travel_avoid_supports.description: The nozzle avoids already printed supports when traveling. This option is only available when combing is enabled.

travel_avoid_distance.label: Travel Avoid Distance
travel_avoid_distance.description: The distance between the nozzle and already printed parts when avoiding during travel moves.

layer_start_x.label: Layer Start X
layer_start_x.description: The X coordinate of the position near where to find the part to start printing each layer.

layer_start_y.label: Layer Start Y
layer_start_y.description: The Y coordinate of the position near where to find the part to start printing each layer.

retraction_hop_enabled.label: Z Hop When Retracted
retraction_hop_enabled.description: Whenever a retraction is done, the build plate is lowered to create clearance between the nozzle and the print. It prevents the nozzle from hitting the print during travel moves, reducing the chance to knock the print from the build plate.

retraction_hop_only_when_collides.label: Z Hop Only Over Printed Parts
retraction_hop_only_when_collides.description: Only perform a Z Hop when moving over printed parts which cannot be avoided by horizontal motion by Avoid Printed Parts when Traveling.

retraction_hop.label: Z Hop Height
retraction_hop.description: The height difference when performing a Z Hop.

retraction_hop_after_extruder_switch.label: Z Hop After Extruder Switch
retraction_hop_after_extruder_switch.description: After the machine switched from one extruder to the other, the build plate is lowered to create clearance between the nozzle and the print. This prevents the nozzle from leaving oozed material on the outside of a print.

retraction_hop_after_extruder_switch_hei.label: Z Hop After Extruder Switch Height
retraction_hop_after_extruder_switch_hei.description: The height difference when performing a Z Hop after extruder switch.

cool_fan_enabled.label: Enable Print Cooling
cool_fan_enabled.description: Enables the print cooling fans while printing. The fans improve print quality on layers with short layer times and bridging / overhangs.

build_fan_full_at_height.label: Build Fan Speed at Height
build_fan_full_at_height.description: The height at which the fans spin on regular fan speed. At the layers below the fan speed gradually increases from Initial Fan Speed to Regular Fan Speed.

build_fan_full_layer.label: Build Fan Speed at Layer
build_fan_full_layer.description: The layer at which the build fans spin on full fan speed. This value is calculated and rounded to a whole number.

cool_fan_speed.label: Fan Speed
cool_fan_speed.description: The speed at which the print cooling fans spin.

cool_fan_speed_min.label: Regular Fan Speed
cool_fan_speed_min.description: The speed at which the fans spin before hitting the threshold. When a layer prints faster than the threshold, the fan speed gradually inclines towards the maximum fan speed.

cool_fan_speed_max.label: Maximum Fan Speed
cool_fan_speed_max.description: The speed at which the fans spin on the minimum layer time. The fan speed gradually increases between the regular fan speed and maximum fan speed when the threshold is hit.

cool_min_layer_time_fan_speed_max.label: Regular/Maximum Fan Speed Threshold
cool_min_layer_time_fan_speed_max.description: The layer time which sets the threshold between regular fan speed and maximum fan speed. Layers that print slower than this time use regular fan speed. For faster layers the fan speed gradually increases towards the maximum fan speed.

cool_fan_speed_0.label: Initial Fan Speed
cool_fan_speed_0.description: The speed at which the fans spin at the start of the print. In subsequent layers the fan speed is gradually increased up to the layer corresponding to Regular Fan Speed at Height.

cool_fan_full_at_height.label: Regular Fan Speed at Height
cool_fan_full_at_height.description: The height at which the fans spin on regular fan speed. At the layers below the fan speed gradually increases from Initial Fan Speed to Regular Fan Speed.

cool_fan_full_layer.label: Regular Fan Speed at Layer
cool_fan_full_layer.description: The layer at which the fans spin on regular fan speed. If regular fan speed at height is set, this value is calculated and rounded to a whole number.

cool_min_layer_time.label: Minimum Layer Time
cool_min_layer_time.description: The minimum time spent in a layer. This forces the printer to slow down, to at least spend the time set here in one layer. This allows the printed material to cool down properly before printing the next layer. Layers may still take shorter than the minimal layer time if Lift Head is disabled and if the Minimum Speed would otherwise be violated.

cool_min_speed.label: Minimum Speed
cool_min_speed.description: The minimum print speed, despite slowing down due to the minimum layer time. When the printer would slow down too much, the pressure in the nozzle would be too low and result in bad print quality.

cool_lift_head.label: Lift Head
cool_lift_head.description: When the minimum speed is hit because of minimum layer time, lift the head away from the print and wait the extra time until the minimum layer time is reached.

cool_min_temperature.label: Small Layer Printing Temperature
cool_min_temperature.description: Gradually reduce to this temperature when printing at reduced speeds because of minimum layer time.

cool_during_extruder_switch.label: Cooling during extruder switch
cool_during_extruder_switch.description:
Whether to activate the cooling fans during a nozzle switch. This can help reducing oozing by cooling the nozzle faster:
  • Unchanged: keep the fans as they were previously
  • Only last extruder: turn on the fan of the last used extruder, but turn the others off (if any). This is useful if you have completely separate extruders.
  • All fans: turn on all fans during nozzle switch. This is useful if you have a single cooling fan, or multiple fans that stay close to each other.

support_enable.label: Generate Support
support_enable.description: Generate structures to support parts of the model which have overhangs. Without these structures, such parts would collapse during printing.

support_extruder_nr.label: Support Extruder
support_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.

support_infill_extruder_nr.label: Support Infill Extruder
support_infill_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the infill of the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.

support_extruder_nr_layer_0.label: First Layer Support Extruder
support_extruder_nr_layer_0.description: The extruder train to use for printing the first layer of support infill. This is used in multi-extrusion.

support_interface_extruder_nr.label: Support Interface Extruder
support_interface_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the roofs and floors of the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.
support_interface_extruder_nr.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and extruders_enabled_count > 1 and support_interface_enable

support_roof_extruder_nr.label: Support Roof Extruder
support_roof_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the roofs of the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.
support_roof_extruder_nr.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and extruders_enabled_count > 1 and support_roof_enable

support_bottom_extruder_nr.label: Support Floor Extruder
support_bottom_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the floors of the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.
support_bottom_extruder_nr.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and extruders_enabled_count > 1 and support_bottom_enable

support_structure.label: Support Structure
support_structure.description: Chooses between the techniques available to generate support. "Normal" support creates a support structure directly below the overhanging parts and drops those areas straight down. "Tree" support creates branches towards the overhanging areas that support the model on the tips of those branches, and allows the branches to crawl around the model to support it from the build plate as much as possible.

support_tree_angle.label: Maximum Branch Angle
support_tree_angle.description: The maximum angle of the branches while they grow around the model. Use a lower angle to make them more vertical and more stable. Use a higher angle to be able to have more reach.

support_tree_branch_diameter.label: Branch Diameter
support_tree_branch_diameter.description: The diameter of the thinnest branches of tree support. Thicker branches are more sturdy. Branches towards the base will be thicker than this.

support_tree_max_diameter.label: Trunk Diameter
support_tree_max_diameter.description: The diameter of the widest branches of tree support. A thicker trunk is more sturdy; a thinner trunk takes up less space on the build plate.

support_tree_branch_diameter_angle.label: Branch Diameter Angle
support_tree_branch_diameter_angle.description: The angle of the branches' diameter as they gradually become thicker towards the bottom. An angle of 0 will cause the branches to have uniform thickness over their length. A bit of an angle can increase stability of the tree support.

support_z_seam_away_from_model.label: Support Z Seam Away from Model
support_z_seam_away_from_model.description: Manage the spatial relationship between the z seam of the support structure and the actual 3D model. This control is crucial as it allows users to ensure the seamless removal of support structures post-printing, without inflicting damage or leaving marks on the printed model.

support_z_seam_min_distance.label: Min Z Seam Distance from Model
support_z_seam_min_distance.description: The distance between the model and its support structure at the z-axis seam.

support_type.label: Support Placement
support_type.description: Adjusts the placement of the support structures. The placement can be set to touching build plate or everywhere. When set to everywhere the support structures will also be printed on the model.

support_tree_angle_slow.label: Preferred Branch Angle
support_tree_angle_slow.description: The preferred angle of the branches, when they do not have to avoid the model. Use a lower angle to make them more vertical and more stable. Use a higher angle for branches to merge faster.

support_tree_max_diameter_increase_by_me.label: Diameter Increase To Model
support_tree_max_diameter_increase_by_me.description: The most the diameter of a branch that has to connect to the model may increase by merging with branches that could reach the buildplate. Increasing this reduces print time, but increases the area of support that rests on model

support_tree_min_height_to_model.label: Minimum Height To Model
support_tree_min_height_to_model.description: How tall a branch has to be if it is placed on the model. Prevents small blobs of support. This setting is ignored when a branch is supporting a support roof.

support_tree_bp_diameter.label: Initial Layer Diameter
support_tree_bp_diameter.description: Diameter every branch tries to achieve when reaching the buildplate. Improves bed adhesion.

support_tree_top_rate.label: Branch Density
support_tree_top_rate.description: Adjusts the density of the support structure used to generate the tips of the branches. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove. Use Support Roof for very high values or ensure support density is similarly high at the top.

support_tree_tip_diameter.label: Tip Diameter
support_tree_tip_diameter.description: The diameter of the top of the tip of the branches of tree support.

support_tree_limit_branch_reach.label: Limit Branch Reach
support_tree_limit_branch_reach.description: Limit how far each branch should travel from the point it supports. This can make the support more sturdy, but will increase the amount of branches (and because of that material usage/print time)

support_tree_branch_reach_limit.label: Optimal Branch Range
support_tree_branch_reach_limit.description: A recomendation to how far branches can move from the points they support. Branches can violate this value to reach their destination (buildplate or a flat part of the model). Lowering this value will make the support more sturdy, but increase the amount of branches (and because of that material usage/print time)

support_tree_rest_preference.label: Rest Preference
support_tree_rest_preference.description: The preferred placement of the support structures. If structures can't be placed at the preferred location, they will be place elsewhere, even if that means placing them on the model.

support_angle.label: Support Overhang Angle
support_angle.description: The minimum angle of overhangs for which support is added. At a value of 0° all overhangs are supported, 90° will not provide any support.

support_pattern.label: Support Pattern
support_pattern.description: The pattern of the support structures of the print. The different options available result in sturdy or easy to remove support.

support_wall_count.label: Support Wall Line Count
support_wall_count.description: The number of walls with which to surround support infill. Adding a wall can make support print more reliably and can support overhangs better, but increases print time and material used.
support_wall_count.minimum_value_warning: (1 if support_pattern == 'concentric' else 0) if support_structure == 'normal' else 1
support_wall_count.value: 1 if support_enable and support_structure == 'tree' else (1 if (support_pattern == 'grid' or support_pattern == 'triangles' or support_pattern == 'concentric') else 0)

support_interface_wall_count.label: Support Interface Wall Line Count
support_interface_wall_count.description: The number of walls with which to surround support interface. Adding a wall can make support print more reliably and can support overhangs better, but increases print time and material used.

support_roof_wall_count.label: Support Roof Wall Line Count
support_roof_wall_count.description: The number of walls with which to surround support interface roof. Adding a wall can make support print more reliably and can support overhangs better, but increases print time and material used.

support_bottom_wall_count.label: Support Bottom Wall Line Count
support_bottom_wall_count.description: The number of walls with which to surround support interface floor. Adding a wall can make support print more reliably and can support overhangs better, but increases print time and material used.

zig_zaggify_support.label: Connect Support Lines
zig_zaggify_support.description: Connect the ends of the support lines together. Enabling this setting can make your support more sturdy and reduce underextrusion, but it will cost more material.
zig_zaggify_support.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and (support_pattern == 'lines' or support_pattern == 'grid' or support_pattern == 'triangles' or support_pattern == 'cross' or support_pattern == 'gyroid')

support_connect_zigzags.label: Connect Support ZigZags
support_connect_zigzags.description: Connect the ZigZags. This will increase the strength of the zig zag support structure.

support_infill_rate.label: Support Density
support_infill_rate.description: Adjusts the density of the support structure. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove.
support_infill_rate.value: 15 if support_enable and support_structure == 'normal' else 0 if support_enable and support_structure == 'tree' else 15

support_line_distance.label: Support Line Distance
support_line_distance.description: Distance between the printed support structure lines. This setting is calculated by the support density.
support_line_distance.value: 0 if support_infill_rate == 0 else (support_line_width * 100) / support_infill_rate * (2 if support_pattern == 'grid' else (3 if support_pattern == 'triangles' else 1))

support_initial_layer_line_distance.label: Initial Layer Support Line Distance
support_initial_layer_line_distance.description: Distance between the printed initial layer support structure lines. This setting is calculated by the support density.

support_infill_density_multiplier_initia.label: Support Infill Density Multiplier Initial Layer
support_infill_density_multiplier_initia.description: Multiplier for the infill on the initial layers of the support. Increasing this may help for bed adhesion.

support_infill_angles.label: Support Infill Line Directions
support_infill_angles.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the default angle 0 degrees.
support_infill_angles.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and support_pattern != 'concentric' and support_infill_rate > 0

support_brim_enable.label: Enable Support Brim
support_brim_enable.description: Generate a brim within the support infill regions of the first layer. This brim is printed underneath the support, not around it. Enabling this setting increases the adhesion of support to the build plate.

support_brim_width.label: Support Brim Width
support_brim_width.description: The width of the brim to print underneath the support. A larger brim enhances adhesion to the build plate, at the cost of some extra material.

support_brim_line_count.label: Support Brim Line Count
support_brim_line_count.description: The number of lines used for the support brim. More brim lines enhance adhesion to the build plate, at the cost of some extra material.

support_z_distance.label: Support Z Distance
support_z_distance.description: Distance from the top/bottom of the support structure to the print. This gap provides clearance to remove the supports after the model is printed. The topmost support layer below the model might be a fraction of regular layers.

support_top_distance.label: Support Top Distance
support_top_distance.description: Distance from the top of the support to the print.

support_bottom_distance.label: Support Bottom Distance
support_bottom_distance.description: Distance from the print to the bottom of the support. Note that this is rounded up to the next layer height.
support_bottom_distance.value: extruderValue(support_bottom_extruder_nr if support_bottom_enable else support_infill_extruder_nr, 'support_z_distance') if support_type == 'everywhere' else 0

support_xy_distance.label: Support X/Y Distance
support_xy_distance.description: Distance of the support structure from the print in the X/Y directions.

support_xy_overrides_z.label: Support Distance Priority
support_xy_overrides_z.description: Whether the Support X/Y Distance overrides the Support Z Distance or vice versa. When X/Y overrides Z the X/Y distance can push away the support from the model, influencing the actual Z distance to the overhang. We can disable this by not applying the X/Y distance around overhangs.

support_xy_distance_overhang.label: Minimum Support X/Y Distance
support_xy_distance_overhang.description: Distance of the support structure from the overhang in the X/Y directions.

support_bottom_stair_step_height.label: Support Stair Step Height
support_bottom_stair_step_height.description: The height of the steps of the stair-like bottom of support resting on the model. A low value makes the support harder to remove, but too high values can lead to unstable support structures. Set to zero to turn off the stair-like behaviour.

support_bottom_stair_step_width.label: Support Stair Step Maximum Width
support_bottom_stair_step_width.description: The maximum width of the steps of the stair-like bottom of support resting on the model. A low value makes the support harder to remove, but too high values can lead to unstable support structures.
support_bottom_stair_step_width.enabled: ((support_enable and support_structure == 'normal') or support_meshes_present) and support_bottom_stair_step_height > 0

support_bottom_stair_step_min_slope.label: Support Stair Step Minimum Slope Angle
support_bottom_stair_step_min_slope.description: The minimum slope of the area for stair-stepping to take effect. Low values should make support easier to remove on shallower slopes, but really low values may result in some very counter-intuitive results on other parts of the model.
support_bottom_stair_step_min_slope.enabled: ((support_enable and support_structure == 'normal') or support_meshes_present) and support_bottom_stair_step_height > 0

support_join_distance.label: Support Join Distance
support_join_distance.description: The maximum distance between support structures in the X/Y directions. When separate structures are closer together than this value, the structures merge into one.

support_offset.label: Support Horizontal Expansion
support_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to all support polygons in each layer. Positive values can smooth out the support areas and result in more sturdy support.

support_infill_sparse_thickness.label: Support Infill Layer Thickness
support_infill_sparse_thickness.description: The thickness per layer of support infill material. This value should always be a multiple of the layer height and is otherwise rounded.

gradual_support_infill_steps.label: Gradual Support Infill Steps
gradual_support_infill_steps.description: Number of times to reduce the support infill density by half when getting further below top surfaces. Areas which are closer to top surfaces get a higher density, up to the Support Infill Density.
gradual_support_infill_steps.maximum_value_warning: 1 if (support_pattern == 'cross' or support_pattern == 'lines' or support_pattern == 'concentric') else 5
gradual_support_infill_steps.maximum_value: (999999 if support_line_distance == 0 else (20 - math.log(support_line_distance) / math.log(2))) if support_structure != 'tree' else 0

gradual_support_infill_step_height.label: Gradual Support Infill Step Height
gradual_support_infill_step_height.description: The height of support infill of a given density before switching to half the density.
gradual_support_infill_step_height.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and support_infill_rate > 0 and gradual_support_infill_steps > 0

minimum_support_area.label: Minimum Support Area
minimum_support_area.description: Minimum area size for support polygons. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will not be generated.

support_interface_enable.label: Enable Support Interface
support_interface_enable.description: Generate a dense interface between the model and the support. This will create a skin at the top of the support on which the model is printed and at the bottom of the support, where it rests on the model.

support_roof_enable.label: Enable Support Roof
support_roof_enable.description: Generate a dense slab of material between the top of support and the model. This will create a skin between the model and support.

support_bottom_enable.label: Enable Support Floor
support_bottom_enable.description: Generate a dense slab of material between the bottom of the support and the model. This will create a skin between the model and support.

support_interface_height.label: Support Interface Thickness
support_interface_height.description: The thickness of the interface of the support where it touches with the model on the bottom or the top.

support_roof_height.label: Support Roof Thickness
support_roof_height.description: The thickness of the support roofs. This controls the amount of dense layers at the top of the support on which the model rests.

support_bottom_height.label: Support Floor Thickness
support_bottom_height.description: The thickness of the support floors. This controls the number of dense layers that are printed on top of places of a model on which support rests.

support_interface_density.label: Support Interface Density
support_interface_density.description: Adjusts the density of the roofs and floors of the support structure. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove.

support_roof_density.label: Support Roof Density
support_roof_density.description: The density of the roofs of the support structure. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove.

support_roof_line_distance.label: Support Roof Line Distance
support_roof_line_distance.description: Distance between the printed support roof lines. This setting is calculated by the Support Roof Density, but can be adjusted separately.
support_roof_line_distance.value: 0 if support_roof_density == 0 else (support_roof_line_width * 100) / support_roof_density * (2 if support_roof_pattern == 'grid' else (3 if support_roof_pattern == 'triangles' else 1))

support_bottom_density.label: Support Floor Density
support_bottom_density.description: The density of the floors of the support structure. A higher value results in better adhesion of the support on top of the model.

support_bottom_line_distance.label: Support Floor Line Distance
support_bottom_line_distance.description: Distance between the printed support floor lines. This setting is calculated by the Support Floor Density, but can be adjusted separately.
support_bottom_line_distance.value: 0 if support_bottom_density == 0 else (support_bottom_line_width * 100) / support_bottom_density * (2 if support_bottom_pattern == 'grid' else (3 if support_bottom_pattern == 'triangles' else 1))

support_interface_pattern.label: Support Interface Pattern
support_interface_pattern.description: The pattern with which the interface of the support with the model is printed.

support_roof_pattern.label: Support Roof Pattern
support_roof_pattern.description: The pattern with which the roofs of the support are printed.

support_bottom_pattern.label: Support Floor Pattern
support_bottom_pattern.description: The pattern with which the floors of the support are printed.

minimum_interface_area.label: Minimum Support Interface Area
minimum_interface_area.description: Minimum area size for support interface polygons. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will be printed as normal support.

minimum_roof_area.label: Minimum Support Roof Area
minimum_roof_area.description: Minimum area size for the roofs of the support. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will be printed as normal support.

minimum_bottom_area.label: Minimum Support Floor Area
minimum_bottom_area.description: Minimum area size for the floors of the support. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will be printed as normal support.
minimum_bottom_area.enabled: support_bottom_enable and ((support_enable and support_structure == 'normal') or support_meshes_present)

support_interface_offset.label: Support Interface Horizontal Expansion
support_interface_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to the support interface polygons.

support_roof_offset.label: Support Roof Horizontal Expansion
support_roof_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to the roofs of the support.

support_bottom_offset.label: Support Floor Horizontal Expansion
support_bottom_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to the floors of the support.

support_interface_priority.label: Support Interface Priority
support_interface_priority.description: How support interface and support will interact when they overlap. Currently only implemented for support roof.

support_interface_angles.label: Support Interface Line Directions
support_interface_angles.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the default angles (alternates between 45 and 135 degrees if interfaces are quite thick or 90 degrees).
support_interface_angles.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and support_interface_enable and support_interface_pattern != 'concentric'

support_roof_angles.label: Support Roof Line Directions
support_roof_angles.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the default angles (alternates between 45 and 135 degrees if interfaces are quite thick or 90 degrees).
support_roof_angles.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and support_roof_enable and support_roof_pattern != 'concentric'

support_bottom_angles.label: Support Floor Line Directions
support_bottom_angles.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the default angles (alternates between 45 and 135 degrees if interfaces are quite thick or 90 degrees).
support_bottom_angles.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and support_bottom_enable and support_bottom_pattern != 'concentric'

support_fan_enable.label: Fan Speed Override
support_fan_enable.description: When enabled, the print cooling fan speed is altered for the skin regions immediately above the support.

support_supported_skin_fan_speed.label: Supported Skin Fan Speed
support_supported_skin_fan_speed.description: Percentage fan speed to use when printing the skin regions immediately above the support. Using a high fan speed can make the support easier to remove.

support_use_towers.label: Use Towers
support_use_towers.description: Use specialized towers to support tiny overhang areas. These towers have a larger diameter than the region they support. Near the overhang the towers' diameter decreases, forming a roof.

support_tower_diameter.label: Tower Diameter
support_tower_diameter.description: The diameter of a special tower.

support_tower_maximum_supported_diameter.label: Maximum Tower-Supported Diameter
support_tower_maximum_supported_diameter.description: Maximum diameter in the X/Y directions of a small area which is to be supported by a specialized support tower.

support_tower_roof_angle.label: Tower Roof Angle
support_tower_roof_angle.description: The angle of a rooftop of a tower. A higher value results in pointed tower roofs, a lower value results in flattened tower roofs.

support_mesh_drop_down.label: Drop Down Support Mesh
support_mesh_drop_down.description: Make support everywhere below the support mesh, so that there's no overhang in the support mesh.

support_meshes_present.label: Scene Has Support Meshes
support_meshes_present.description: There are support meshes present in the scene. This setting is controlled by Cura.

prime_blob_enable.label: Enable Prime Blob
prime_blob_enable.description: Whether to prime the filament with a blob before printing. Turning this setting on will ensure that the extruder will have material ready at the nozzle before printing. Printing Brim or Skirt can act like priming too, in which case turning this setting off saves some time.

extruder_prime_pos_x.label: Extruder Prime X Position
extruder_prime_pos_x.description: The X coordinate of the position where the nozzle primes at the start of printing.

extruder_prime_pos_y.label: Extruder Prime Y Position
extruder_prime_pos_y.description: The Y coordinate of the position where the nozzle primes at the start of printing.

adhesion_type.label: Build Plate Adhesion Type
adhesion_type.description: Different options that help to improve both priming your extrusion and adhesion to the build plate. Brim adds a single layer flat area around the base of your model to prevent warping. Raft adds a thick grid with a roof below the model. Skirt is a line printed around the model, but not connected to the model.

adhesion_extruder_nr.label: Build Plate Adhesion Extruder
adhesion_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the skirt/brim/raft. This is used in multi-extrusion.

skirt_brim_extruder_nr.label: Skirt/Brim Extruder
skirt_brim_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the skirt or brim. This is used in multi-extrusion.

raft_base_extruder_nr.label: Raft Base Extruder
raft_base_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the first layer of the raft. This is used in multi-extrusion.

raft_interface_extruder_nr.label: Raft Middle Extruder
raft_interface_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the middle layer of the raft. This is used in multi-extrusion.

raft_surface_extruder_nr.label: Raft Top Extruder
raft_surface_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the top layer(s) of the raft. This is used in multi-extrusion.

skirt_line_count.label: Skirt Line Count
skirt_line_count.description: Multiple skirt lines help to prime your extrusion better for small models. Setting this to 0 will disable the skirt.

skirt_height.label: Skirt Height
skirt_height.description: Printing the innermost skirt line with multiple layers makes it easy to remove the skirt.

skirt_gap.label: Skirt Distance
skirt_gap.description:
The horizontal distance between the skirt and the first layer of the print.
This is the minimum distance. Multiple skirt lines will extend outwards from this distance.

skirt_brim_minimal_length.label: Skirt/Brim Minimum Length
skirt_brim_minimal_length.description: The minimum length of the skirt or brim. If this length is not reached by all skirt or brim lines together, more skirt or brim lines will be added until the minimum length is reached. Note: If the line count is set to 0 this is ignored.

brim_width.label: Brim Width
brim_width.description: The distance from the model to the outermost brim line. A larger brim enhances adhesion to the build plate, but also reduces the effective print area.

brim_line_count.label: Brim Line Count
brim_line_count.description: The number of lines used for a brim. More brim lines enhance adhesion to the build plate, but also reduces the effective print area.

brim_gap.label: Brim Distance
brim_gap.description: The horizontal distance between the first brim line and the outline of the first layer of the print. A small gap can make the brim easier to remove while still providing the thermal benefits.

brim_replaces_support.label: Brim Replaces Support
brim_replaces_support.description: Enforce brim to be printed around the model even if that space would otherwise be occupied by support. This replaces some regions of the first layer of support by brim regions.

brim_location.label: Brim Location
brim_location.description: Print a brim on the outside of the model, inside, or both. Depending on the model, this helps reducing the amount of brim you need to remove afterwards, while ensuring a proper bed adhesion.

brim_inside_margin.label: Brim Avoid Margin
brim_inside_margin.description: A brim around a model may touch an other model where you don't want it. This removes all brim within this distance from brimless models.

brim_smart_ordering.label: Smart Brim
brim_smart_ordering.description: Swap print order of the innermost and second innermost brim lines. This improves brim removal.

raft_margin.label: Raft Extra Margin
raft_margin.description: If the raft is enabled, this is the extra raft area around the model which is also given a raft. Increasing this margin will create a stronger raft while using more material and leaving less area for your print.

raft_base_margin.label: Raft Base Extra Margin
raft_base_margin.description: If the raft base is enabled, this is the extra raft area around the model which is also given a raft. Increasing this margin will create a stronger raft while using more material and leaving less area for your print.

raft_interface_margin.label: Raft Middle Extra Margin
raft_interface_margin.description: If the raft middle is enabled, this is the extra raft area around the model which is also given a raft. Increasing this margin will create a stronger raft while using more material and leaving less area for your print.

raft_surface_margin.label: Raft Top Extra Margin
raft_surface_margin.description: If the raft top is enabled, this is the extra raft area around the model which is also given a raft. Increasing this margin will create a stronger raft while using more material and leaving less area for your print.

raft_remove_inside_corners.label: Remove Raft Inside Corners
raft_remove_inside_corners.description: Remove inside corners from the raft, causing the raft to become convex.

raft_base_remove_inside_corners.label: Remove Raft Base Inside Corners
raft_base_remove_inside_corners.description: Remove inside corners from the raft base, causing the raft to become convex.

raft_interface_remove_inside_corners.label: Remove Raft Middle Inside Corners
raft_interface_remove_inside_corners.description: Remove inside corners from the raft middle part, causing the raft to become convex.

raft_surface_remove_inside_corners.label: Remove Raft Top Inside Corners
raft_surface_remove_inside_corners.description: Remove inside corners from the raft top part, causing the raft to become convex.

raft_smoothing.label: Raft Smoothing
raft_smoothing.description: This setting controls how much inner corners in the raft outline are rounded. Inward corners are rounded to a semi circle with a radius equal to the value given here. This setting also removes holes in the raft outline which are smaller than such a circle.

raft_base_smoothing.label: Raft Base Smoothing
raft_base_smoothing.description: This setting controls how much inner corners in the raft base outline are rounded. Inward corners are rounded to a semi circle with a radius equal to the value given here. This setting also removes holes in the raft outline which are smaller than such a circle.

raft_interface_smoothing.label: Raft Middle Smoothing
raft_interface_smoothing.description: This setting controls how much inner corners in the raft middle outline are rounded. Inward corners are rounded to a semi circle with a radius equal to the value given here. This setting also removes holes in the raft outline which are smaller than such a circle.

raft_surface_smoothing.label: Raft Top Smoothing
raft_surface_smoothing.description: This setting controls how much inner corners in the raft top outline are rounded. Inward corners are rounded to a semi circle with a radius equal to the value given here. This setting also removes holes in the raft outline which are smaller than such a circle.

raft_airgap.label: Raft Air Gap
raft_airgap.description: The gap between the final raft layer and the first layer of the model. Only the first layer is raised by this amount to lower the bonding between the raft layer and the model. Makes it easier to peel off the raft.

layer_0_z_overlap.label: Initial Layer Z Overlap
layer_0_z_overlap.description:
Make the first and second layer of the model overlap in the Z direction to compensate for the filament lost in the airgap. All models above the first model layer will be shifted down by this amount.
It may be noted that sometimes the second layer is printed below initial layer because of this setting. This is intended behavior

raft_base_thickness.label: Raft Base Thickness
raft_base_thickness.description: Layer thickness of the base raft layer. This should be a thick layer which sticks firmly to the printer build plate.

raft_base_line_width.label: Raft Base Line Width
raft_base_line_width.description: Width of the lines in the base raft layer. These should be thick lines to assist in build plate adhesion.

raft_base_line_spacing.label: Raft Base Line Spacing
raft_base_line_spacing.description: The distance between the raft lines for the base raft layer. Wide spacing makes for easy removal of the raft from the build plate.

raft_base_infill_overlap.label: Raft Base Infill Overlap Percentage
raft_base_infill_overlap.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls of the raft base, as a percentage of the infill line width. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

raft_base_infill_overlap_mm.label: Raft Base Infill Overlap
raft_base_infill_overlap_mm.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls of the raft base. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

raft_interface_layers.label: Raft Middle Layers
raft_interface_layers.description: The number of layers between the base and the surface of the raft. These comprise the main thickness of the raft. Increasing this creates a thicker, sturdier raft.

raft_interface_thickness.label: Raft Middle Thickness
raft_interface_thickness.description: Layer thickness of the middle raft layer.

raft_interface_line_width.label: Raft Middle Line Width
raft_interface_line_width.description: Width of the lines in the middle raft layer. Making the second layer extrude more causes the lines to stick to the build plate.

raft_interface_line_spacing.label: Raft Middle Spacing
raft_interface_line_spacing.description: The distance between the raft lines for the middle raft layer. The spacing of the middle should be quite wide, while being dense enough to support the top raft layers.

raft_interface_z_offset.label: Raft Interface Z Offset
raft_interface_z_offset.description: When printing the first layer of the raft interface, translate by this offset to customize the adhesion between base and interface. A negative offset should improve the adhesion.

raft_interface_infill_overlap.label: Raft Interface Infill Overlap Percentage
raft_interface_infill_overlap.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls of the raft interface, as a percentage of the infill line width. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

raft_interface_infill_overlap_mm.label: Raft Interface Infill Overlap
raft_interface_infill_overlap_mm.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls of the raft interface. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

raft_surface_layers.label: Raft Top Layers
raft_surface_layers.description: The number of top layers on top of the 2nd raft layer. These are fully filled layers that the model sits on. 2 layers result in a smoother top surface than 1.

raft_surface_thickness.label: Raft Top Layer Thickness
raft_surface_thickness.description: Layer thickness of the top raft layers.

raft_surface_line_width.label: Raft Top Line Width
raft_surface_line_width.description: Width of the lines in the top surface of the raft. These can be thin lines so that the top of the raft becomes smooth.

raft_surface_line_spacing.label: Raft Top Spacing
raft_surface_line_spacing.description: The distance between the raft lines for the top raft layers. The spacing should be equal to the line width, so that the surface is solid.

raft_surface_z_offset.label: Raft Surface Z Offset
raft_surface_z_offset.description: When printing the first layer of the raft surface, translate by this offset to customize the adhesion between interface and surface. A negative offset should improve the adhesion.

raft_surface_monotonic.label: Monotonic Raft Top Surface Order
raft_surface_monotonic.description: Print raft top surface lines in an ordering that causes them to always overlap with adjacent lines in a single direction. This takes slightly more time to print, but makes the surface look more consistent, which is also visible on the model bottom surface.

raft_surface_infill_overlap.label: Raft Surface Infill Overlap Percentage
raft_surface_infill_overlap.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls of the raft surface, as a percentage of the infill line width. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

raft_surface_infill_overlap_mm.label: Raft Surface Infill Overlap
raft_surface_infill_overlap_mm.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls of the raft surface. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

raft_wall_count.label: Raft Wall Count
raft_wall_count.description: The number of contours to print around the linear pattern of the raft.

raft_base_wall_count.label: Raft Base Wall Count
raft_base_wall_count.description: The number of contours to print around the linear pattern in the base layer of the raft.

raft_interface_wall_count.label: Raft Middle Wall Count
raft_interface_wall_count.description: The number of contours to print around the linear pattern in the middle layers of the raft.

raft_surface_wall_count.label: Raft Top Wall Count
raft_surface_wall_count.description: The number of contours to print around the linear pattern in the top layers of the raft.

raft_speed.label: Raft Print Speed
raft_speed.description: The speed at which the raft is printed.

raft_base_speed.label: Raft Base Print Speed
raft_base_speed.description: The speed at which the base raft layer is printed. This should be printed quite slowly, as the volume of material coming out of the nozzle is quite high.

raft_interface_speed.label: Raft Middle Print Speed
raft_interface_speed.description: The speed at which the middle raft layer is printed. This should be printed quite slowly, as the volume of material coming out of the nozzle is quite high.

raft_surface_speed.label: Raft Top Print Speed
raft_surface_speed.description: The speed at which the top raft layers are printed. These should be printed a bit slower, so that the nozzle can slowly smooth out adjacent surface lines.

raft_acceleration.label: Raft Print Acceleration
raft_acceleration.description: The acceleration with which the raft is printed.

raft_base_acceleration.label: Raft Base Print Acceleration
raft_base_acceleration.description: The acceleration with which the base raft layer is printed.

raft_interface_acceleration.label: Raft Middle Print Acceleration
raft_interface_acceleration.description: The acceleration with which the middle raft layer is printed.

raft_surface_acceleration.label: Raft Top Print Acceleration
raft_surface_acceleration.description: The acceleration with which the top raft layers are printed.

raft_jerk.label: Raft Print Jerk
raft_jerk.description: The jerk with which the raft is printed.

raft_base_jerk.label: Raft Base Print Jerk
raft_base_jerk.description: The jerk with which the base raft layer is printed.

raft_interface_jerk.label: Raft Middle Print Jerk
raft_interface_jerk.description: The jerk with which the middle raft layer is printed.

raft_surface_jerk.label: Raft Top Print Jerk
raft_surface_jerk.description: The jerk with which the top raft layers are printed.

raft_fan_speed.label: Raft Fan Speed
raft_fan_speed.description: The fan speed for the raft.

raft_base_fan_speed.label: Raft Base Fan Speed
raft_base_fan_speed.description: The fan speed for the base raft layer.

raft_interface_fan_speed.label: Raft Middle Fan Speed
raft_interface_fan_speed.description: The fan speed for the middle raft layer.

raft_surface_fan_speed.label: Raft Top Fan Speed
raft_surface_fan_speed.description: The fan speed for the top raft layers.

raft_flow.label: Raft Flow
raft_flow.description: The amount of material, relative to a normal extrusion line, to extrude during raft printing. Having an increased flow may improve adhesion and raft structural strength.

raft_base_flow.label: Raft Base Flow
raft_base_flow.description: The amount of material, relative to a normal extrusion line, to extrude during raft base printing. Having an increased flow may improve adhesion and raft structural strength.

raft_interface_flow.label: Raft Interface Flow
raft_interface_flow.description: The amount of material, relative to a normal extrusion line, to extrude during raft interface printing. Having an increased flow may improve adhesion and raft structural strength.

raft_surface_flow.label: Raft Surface Flow
raft_surface_flow.description: The amount of material, relative to a normal extrusion line, to extrude during raft surface printing. Having an increased flow may improve adhesion and raft structural strength.

dual.label: Dual Extrusion
dual.description: Settings used for printing with multiple extruders.

prime_tower_enable.label: Enable Prime Tower
prime_tower_enable.description: Print a tower next to the print which serves to prime the material after each nozzle switch.

prime_tower_mode.label: Prime Tower Type
prime_tower_mode.description:
How to generate the prime tower:
  • Normal: create a bucket in which secondary materials are primed
  • Interleaved: create a prime tower as sparse as possible. This will save time and filament, but is only possible if the used materials adhere to each other
prime_tower_mode.resolve: 'interleaved' if all(mode == 'interleaved' for mode in extruderValues('prime_tower_mode')) else 'interleaved' if (all(material_type_var == extruderValues('material_type')[0] for material_type_var in extruderValues('material_type')) and all(material_brand_var == extruderValues('material_brand')[0] for material_brand_var in extruderValues('material_brand'))) else 'normal'

prime_tower_size.label: Prime Tower Size
prime_tower_size.description: The width of the prime tower.

prime_tower_min_volume.label: Prime Tower Minimum Volume
prime_tower_min_volume.description: The minimum volume for each layer of the prime tower in order to purge enough material.

prime_tower_max_bridging_distance.label: Prime Tower Maximum Bridging Distance
prime_tower_max_bridging_distance.description: The maximum length of the branches which may be printed over the air.

prime_tower_min_shell_thickness.label: Prime Tower Minimum Shell Thickness
prime_tower_min_shell_thickness.description: The minimum thickness of the prime tower shell. You may increase it to make the prime tower stronger.

prime_tower_position_x.label: Prime Tower X Position
prime_tower_position_x.description: The x coordinate of the position of the prime tower.
prime_tower_position_x.value: ((resolveOrValue('machine_width') / 2 + resolveOrValue('prime_tower_size') / 2) if resolveOrValue('machine_shape') == 'elliptic' else (resolveOrValue('machine_width') - (resolveOrValue('prime_tower_base_size') if (resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'raft' or resolveOrValue('prime_tower_brim_enable')) else 0) - max(max(extruderValues('travel_avoid_distance')) + max(extruderValues('machine_nozzle_offset_x')) + max(extruderValues('support_offset')) + (extruderValue(skirt_brim_extruder_nr, 'skirt_brim_line_width') * extruderValue(skirt_brim_extruder_nr, 'skirt_line_count') * extruderValue(skirt_brim_extruder_nr, 'initial_layer_line_width_factor') / 100 + extruderValue(skirt_brim_extruder_nr, 'skirt_gap') if resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'skirt' else 0) + (resolveOrValue('draft_shield_dist') if resolveOrValue('draft_shield_enabled') else 0), max(map(abs, extruderValues('machine_nozzle_offset_x'))), 1))) - (resolveOrValue('machine_width') / 2 if resolveOrValue('machine_center_is_zero') else 0)
prime_tower_position_x.maximum_value: (machine_width / 2 if machine_center_is_zero else machine_width) - (resolveOrValue('prime_tower_base_size') if (resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'raft' or resolveOrValue('prime_tower_brim_enable')) else 0)
prime_tower_position_x.minimum_value: resolveOrValue('prime_tower_size') + (resolveOrValue('prime_tower_base_size') if (resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'raft' or resolveOrValue('prime_tower_brim_enable')) else 0) - (machine_width / 2 if machine_center_is_zero else 0)

prime_tower_position_y.label: Prime Tower Y Position
prime_tower_position_y.description: The y coordinate of the position of the prime tower.
prime_tower_position_y.value: machine_depth - prime_tower_size - (resolveOrValue('prime_tower_base_size') if (resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'raft' or resolveOrValue('prime_tower_brim_enable')) else 0) - max(max(extruderValues('travel_avoid_distance')) + max(extruderValues('machine_nozzle_offset_y')) + max(extruderValues('support_offset')) + (extruderValue(skirt_brim_extruder_nr, 'skirt_brim_line_width') * extruderValue(skirt_brim_extruder_nr, 'skirt_line_count') * extruderValue(skirt_brim_extruder_nr, 'initial_layer_line_width_factor') / 100 + extruderValue(skirt_brim_extruder_nr, 'skirt_gap') if resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'skirt' else 0) + (resolveOrValue('draft_shield_dist') if resolveOrValue('draft_shield_enabled') else 0), max(map(abs, extruderValues('machine_nozzle_offset_y'))), 1) - (resolveOrValue('machine_depth') / 2 if resolveOrValue('machine_center_is_zero') else 0)
prime_tower_position_y.maximum_value: (machine_depth / 2 - resolveOrValue('prime_tower_size') if machine_center_is_zero else machine_depth - resolveOrValue('prime_tower_size')) - (resolveOrValue('prime_tower_base_size') if (resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'raft' or resolveOrValue('prime_tower_brim_enable')) else 0)
prime_tower_position_y.minimum_value: (machine_depth / -2 if machine_center_is_zero else 0) + (resolveOrValue('prime_tower_base_size') if (resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'raft' or resolveOrValue('prime_tower_brim_enable')) else 0)

prime_tower_wipe_enabled.label: Wipe Inactive Nozzle on Prime Tower
prime_tower_wipe_enabled.description: After printing the prime tower with one nozzle, wipe the oozed material from the other nozzle off on the prime tower.

prime_tower_brim_enable.label: Prime Tower Base
prime_tower_brim_enable.description: By enabling this setting, your prime-tower will get a brim, even if the model doesn't. If you want a sturdier base for a high tower, you can increase the base height.

prime_tower_base_size.label: Prime Tower Base Size
prime_tower_base_size.description: The width of the prime tower brim/base. A larger base enhances adhesion to the build plate, but also reduces the effective print area.

prime_tower_base_height.label: Prime Tower Base Height
prime_tower_base_height.description: The height of the prime tower base. Increasing this value will result in a more sturdy prime tower because the base will be wider. If this setting is too low, the prime tower will not have a sturdy base.

prime_tower_base_curve_magnitude.label: Prime Tower Base Slope
prime_tower_base_curve_magnitude.description: The magnitude factor used for the slope of the prime tower base. If you increase this value, the base will become slimmer. If you decrease it, the base will become thicker.

prime_tower_raft_base_line_spacing.label: Prime Tower Raft Line Spacing
prime_tower_raft_base_line_spacing.description: The distance between the raft lines for the unique prime tower raft layer. Wide spacing makes for easy removal of the raft from the build plate.

ooze_shield_enabled.label: Enable Ooze Shield
ooze_shield_enabled.description: Enable exterior ooze shield. This will create a shell around the model which is likely to wipe a second nozzle if it's at the same height as the first nozzle.

ooze_shield_angle.label: Ooze Shield Angle
ooze_shield_angle.description: The maximum angle a part in the ooze shield will have. With 0 degrees being vertical, and 90 degrees being horizontal. A smaller angle leads to less failed ooze shields, but more material.

ooze_shield_dist.label: Ooze Shield Distance
ooze_shield_dist.description: Distance of the ooze shield from the print, in the X/Y directions.

switch_extruder_retraction_amount.label: Nozzle Switch Retraction Distance
switch_extruder_retraction_amount.description: The amount of retraction when switching extruders. Set to 0 for no retraction at all. This should generally be the same as the length of the heat zone.

switch_extruder_retraction_speeds.label: Nozzle Switch Retraction Speed
switch_extruder_retraction_speeds.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted. A higher retraction speed works better, but a very high retraction speed can lead to filament grinding.

switch_extruder_retraction_speed.label: Nozzle Switch Retract Speed
switch_extruder_retraction_speed.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted during a nozzle switch retract.

switch_extruder_prime_speed.label: Nozzle Switch Prime Speed
switch_extruder_prime_speed.description: The speed at which the filament is pushed back after a nozzle switch retraction.

switch_extruder_extra_prime_amount.label: Nozzle Switch Extra Prime Amount
switch_extruder_extra_prime_amount.description: Extra material to prime after nozzle switching.

interlocking_enable.label: Generate Interlocking Structure
interlocking_enable.description: At the locations where models touch, generate an interlocking beam structure. This improves the adhesion between models, especially models printed in different materials.

interlocking_beam_width.label: Interlocking Beam Width
interlocking_beam_width.description: The width of the interlocking structure beams.

interlocking_orientation.label: Interlocking Structure Orientation
interlocking_orientation.description: The height of the beams of the interlocking structure, measured in number of layers. Less layers is stronger, but more prone to defects.

interlocking_beam_layer_count.label: Interlocking Beam Layer Count
interlocking_beam_layer_count.description: The height of the beams of the interlocking structure, measured in number of layers. Less layers is stronger, but more prone to defects.

interlocking_depth.label: Interlocking Depth
interlocking_depth.description: The distance from the boundary between models to generate interlocking structure, measured in cells. Too few cells will result in poor adhesion.

interlocking_boundary_avoidance.label: Interlocking Boundary Avoidance
interlocking_boundary_avoidance.description: The distance from the outside of a model where interlocking structures will not be generated, measured in cells.

meshfix.label: Mesh Fixes
meshfix.description: Make the meshes more suited for 3D printing.

meshfix_union_all.label: Union Overlapping Volumes
meshfix_union_all.description: Ignore the internal geometry arising from overlapping volumes within a mesh and print the volumes as one. This may cause unintended internal cavities to disappear.

meshfix_union_all_remove_holes.label: Remove All Holes
meshfix_union_all_remove_holes.description: Remove the holes in each layer and keep only the outside shape. This will ignore any invisible internal geometry. However, it also ignores layer holes which can be viewed from above or below.

meshfix_extensive_stitching.label: Extensive Stitching
meshfix_extensive_stitching.description: Extensive stitching tries to stitch up open holes in the mesh by closing the hole with touching polygons. This option can introduce a lot of processing time.

meshfix_keep_open_polygons.label: Keep Disconnected Faces
meshfix_keep_open_polygons.description: Normally Cura tries to stitch up small holes in the mesh and remove parts of a layer with big holes. Enabling this option keeps those parts which cannot be stitched. This option should be used as a last resort option when everything else fails to produce proper g-code.

multiple_mesh_overlap.label: Merged Meshes Overlap
multiple_mesh_overlap.description: Make meshes which are touching each other overlap a bit. This makes them bond together better.

carve_multiple_volumes.label: Remove Mesh Intersection
carve_multiple_volumes.description: Remove areas where multiple meshes are overlapping with each other. This may be used if merged dual material objects overlap with each other.

alternate_carve_order.label: Alternate Mesh Removal
alternate_carve_order.description: Switch to which mesh intersecting volumes will belong with every layer, so that the overlapping meshes become interwoven. Turning this setting off will cause one of the meshes to obtain all of the volume in the overlap, while it is removed from the other meshes.
alternate_carve_order.enabled: carve_multiple_volumes and all(p != 'surface' for p in extruderValues('magic_mesh_surface_mode'))

remove_empty_first_layers.label: Remove Empty First Layers
remove_empty_first_layers.description: Remove empty layers beneath the first printed layer if they are present. Disabling this setting can cause empty first layers if the Slicing Tolerance setting is set to Exclusive or Middle.

meshfix_maximum_resolution.label: Maximum Resolution
meshfix_maximum_resolution.description: The minimum size of a line segment after slicing. If you increase this, the mesh will have a lower resolution. This may allow the printer to keep up with the speed it has to process g-code and will increase slice speed by removing details of the mesh that it can't process anyway.

meshfix_maximum_travel_resolution.label: Maximum Travel Resolution
meshfix_maximum_travel_resolution.description: The minimum size of a travel line segment after slicing. If you increase this, the travel moves will have less smooth corners. This may allow the printer to keep up with the speed it has to process g-code, but it may cause model avoidance to become less accurate.

meshfix_maximum_deviation.label: Maximum Deviation
meshfix_maximum_deviation.description: The maximum deviation allowed when reducing the resolution for the Maximum Resolution setting. If you increase this, the print will be less accurate, but the g-code will be smaller. Maximum Deviation is a limit for Maximum Resolution, so if the two conflict the Maximum Deviation will always be held true.

meshfix_maximum_extrusion_area_deviation.label: Maximum Extrusion Area Deviation
meshfix_maximum_extrusion_area_deviation.description: The maximum extrusion area deviation allowed when removing intermediate points from a straight line. An intermediate point may serve as width-changing point in a long straight line. Therefore, if it is removed, it will cause the line to have a uniform width and, as a result, lose (or gain) a bit of extrusion area. If you increase this you may notice slight under- (or over-) extrusion in between straight parallel walls, as more intermediate width-changing points will be allowed to be removed. Your print will be less accurate, but the g-code will be smaller.

meshfix_fluid_motion_enabled.label: Enable Fluid Motion
meshfix_fluid_motion_enabled.description: When enabled tool paths are corrected for printers with smooth motion planners. Small movements that deviate from the general tool path direction are smoothed to improve fluid motions.

meshfix_fluid_motion_shift_distance.label: Fluid Motion Shift Distance
meshfix_fluid_motion_shift_distance.description: Distance points are shifted to smooth the path

meshfix_fluid_motion_small_distance.label: Fluid Motion Small Distance
meshfix_fluid_motion_small_distance.description: Distance points are shifted to smooth the path

meshfix_fluid_motion_angle.label: Fluid Motion Angle
meshfix_fluid_motion_angle.description: If a toolpath-segment deviates more than this angle from the general motion it is smoothed.

blackmagic.label: Special Modes
blackmagic.description: Non-traditional ways to print your models.

print_sequence.label: Print Sequence
print_sequence.description: Whether to print all models one layer at a time or to wait for one model to finish, before moving on to the next. One at a time mode is possible if a) only one extruder is enabled and b) all models are separated in such a way that the whole print head can move in between and all models are lower than the distance between the nozzle and the X/Y axes.

user_defined_print_order_enabled.label: Set Print Sequence Manually
user_defined_print_order_enabled.description: Allows you to order the object list to manually set the print sequence. First object from the list will be printed first.

infill_mesh.label: Infill Mesh
infill_mesh.description: Use this mesh to modify the infill of other meshes with which it overlaps. Replaces infill regions of other meshes with regions for this mesh. It's suggested to only print one Wall and no Top/Bottom Skin for this mesh.

infill_mesh_order.label: Mesh Processing Rank
infill_mesh_order.description: Determines the priority of this mesh when considering multiple overlapping infill meshes. Areas where multiple infill meshes overlap will take on the settings of the mesh with the highest rank. An infill mesh with a higher rank will modify the infill of infill meshes with lower rank and normal meshes.

cutting_mesh.label: Cutting Mesh
cutting_mesh.description: Limit the volume of this mesh to within other meshes. You can use this to make certain areas of one mesh print with different settings and with a whole different extruder.

mold_enabled.label: Mold
mold_enabled.description: Print models as a mold, which can be cast in order to get a model which resembles the models on the build plate.

mold_width.label: Minimal Mold Width
mold_width.description: The minimal distance between the outside of the mold and the outside of the model.

mold_roof_height.label: Mold Roof Height
mold_roof_height.description: The height above horizontal parts in your model which to print mold.

mold_angle.label: Mold Angle
mold_angle.description: The angle of overhang of the outer walls created for the mold. 0° will make the outer shell of the mold vertical, while 90° will make the outside of the model follow the contour of the model.

support_mesh.label: Support Mesh
support_mesh.description: Use this mesh to specify support areas. This can be used to generate support structure.

anti_overhang_mesh.label: Anti Overhang Mesh
anti_overhang_mesh.description: Use this mesh to specify where no part of the model should be detected as overhang. This can be used to remove unwanted support structure.

magic_mesh_surface_mode.label: Surface Mode
magic_mesh_surface_mode.description: Treat the model as a surface only, a volume, or volumes with loose surfaces. The normal print mode only prints enclosed volumes. "Surface" prints a single wall tracing the mesh surface with no infill and no top/bottom skin. "Both" prints enclosed volumes like normal and any remaining polygons as surfaces.

magic_spiralize.label: Spiralize Outer Contour
magic_spiralize.description: Spiralize smooths out the Z move of the outer edge. This will create a steady Z increase over the whole print. This feature turns a solid model into a single walled print with a solid bottom. This feature should only be enabled when each layer only contains a single part.

smooth_spiralized_contours.label: Smooth Spiralized Contours
smooth_spiralized_contours.description: Smooth the spiralized contours to reduce the visibility of the Z seam (the Z seam should be barely visible on the print but will still be visible in the layer view). Note that smoothing will tend to blur fine surface details.

relative_extrusion.label: Relative Extrusion
relative_extrusion.description: Use relative extrusion rather than absolute extrusion. Using relative E-steps makes for easier post-processing of the g-code. However, it's not supported by all printers and it may produce very slight deviations in the amount of deposited material compared to absolute E-steps. Irrespective of this setting, the extrusion mode will always be set to absolute before any g-code script is output.

experimental.label: Experimental
experimental.description: Features that haven't completely been fleshed out yet.

slicing_tolerance.label: Slicing Tolerance
slicing_tolerance.description: Vertical tolerance in the sliced layers. The contours of a layer are normally generated by taking cross sections through the middle of each layer's thickness (Middle). Alternatively each layer can have the areas which fall inside of the volume throughout the entire thickness of the layer (Exclusive) or a layer has the areas which fall inside anywhere within the layer (Inclusive). Inclusive retains the most details, Exclusive makes for the best fit and Middle stays closest to the original surface.

infill_enable_travel_optimization.label: Infill Travel Optimization
infill_enable_travel_optimization.description: When enabled, the order in which the infill lines are printed is optimized to reduce the distance travelled. The reduction in travel time achieved very much depends on the model being sliced, infill pattern, density, etc. Note that, for some models that have many small areas of infill, the time to slice the model may be greatly increased.

material_flow_temp_graph.label: Flow Temperature Graph
material_flow_temp_graph.description: Data linking material flow (in mm3 per second) to temperature (degrees Celsius).

minimum_polygon_circumference.label: Minimum Polygon Circumference
minimum_polygon_circumference.description: Polygons in sliced layers that have a circumference smaller than this amount will be filtered out. Lower values lead to higher resolution mesh at the cost of slicing time. It is meant mostly for high resolution SLA printers and very tiny 3D models with a lot of details.

support_skip_some_zags.label: Break Up Support In Chunks
support_skip_some_zags.description: Skip some support line connections to make the support structure easier to break away. This setting is applicable to the Zig Zag support infill pattern.

support_skip_zag_per_mm.label: Support Chunk Size
support_skip_zag_per_mm.description: Leave out a connection between support lines once every N millimeter to make the support structure easier to break away.
support_skip_zag_per_mm.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and support_pattern == 'zigzag' and support_skip_some_zags

support_zag_skip_count.label: Support Chunk Line Count
support_zag_skip_count.description: Skip one in every N connection lines to make the support structure easier to break away.
support_zag_skip_count.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and support_pattern == 'zigzag' and support_skip_some_zags

draft_shield_enabled.label: Enable Draft Shield
draft_shield_enabled.description: This will create a wall around the model, which traps (hot) air and shields against exterior airflow. Especially useful for materials which warp easily.

draft_shield_dist.label: Draft Shield X/Y Distance
draft_shield_dist.description: Distance of the draft shield from the print, in the X/Y directions.

draft_shield_height_limitation.label: Draft Shield Limitation
draft_shield_height_limitation.description: Set the height of the draft shield. Choose to print the draft shield at the full height of the model or at a limited height.

draft_shield_height.label: Draft Shield Height
draft_shield_height.description: Height limitation of the draft shield. Above this height no draft shield will be printed.

conical_overhang_enabled.label: Make Overhang Printable
conical_overhang_enabled.description: Change the geometry of the printed model such that minimal support is required. Steep overhangs will become shallow overhangs. Overhanging areas will drop down to become more vertical.

conical_overhang_angle.label: Maximum Model Angle
conical_overhang_angle.description: The maximum angle of overhangs after the they have been made printable. At a value of 0° all overhangs are replaced by a piece of model connected to the build plate, 90° will not change the model in any way.

conical_overhang_hole_size.label: Maximum Overhang Hole Area
conical_overhang_hole_size.description: The maximum area of a hole in the base of the model before it's removed by Make Overhang Printable.  Holes smaller than this will be retained.  A value of 0 mm² will fill all holes in the models base.

coasting_enable.label: Enable Coasting
coasting_enable.description: Coasting replaces the last part of an extrusion path with a travel path. The oozed material is used to print the last piece of the extrusion path in order to reduce stringing.

coasting_volume.label: Coasting Volume
coasting_volume.description: The volume otherwise oozed. This value should generally be close to the nozzle diameter cubed.

coasting_min_volume.label: Minimum Volume Before Coasting
coasting_min_volume.description: The smallest volume an extrusion path should have before allowing coasting. For smaller extrusion paths, less pressure has been built up in the bowden tube and so the coasted volume is scaled linearly. This value should always be larger than the Coasting Volume.

coasting_speed.label: Coasting Speed
coasting_speed.description: The speed by which to move during coasting, relative to the speed of the extrusion path. A value slightly under 100% is advised, since during the coasting move the pressure in the bowden tube drops.

cross_infill_pocket_size.label: Cross 3D Pocket Size
cross_infill_pocket_size.description: The size of pockets at four-way crossings in the cross 3D pattern at heights where the pattern is touching itself.

cross_infill_density_image.label: Cross Infill Density Image
cross_infill_density_image.description: The file location of an image of which the brightness values determine the minimal density at the corresponding location in the infill of the print.

cross_support_density_image.label: Cross Fill Density Image for Support
cross_support_density_image.description: The file location of an image of which the brightness values determine the minimal density at the corresponding location in the support.

support_conical_enabled.label: Enable Conical Support
support_conical_enabled.description: Make support areas smaller at the bottom than at the overhang.

support_conical_angle.label: Conical Support Angle
support_conical_angle.description: The angle of the tilt of conical support. With 0 degrees being vertical, and 90 degrees being horizontal. Smaller angles cause the support to be more sturdy, but consist of more material. Negative angles cause the base of the support to be wider than the top.

support_conical_min_width.label: Conical Support Minimum Width
support_conical_min_width.description: Minimum width to which the base of the conical support area is reduced. Small widths can lead to unstable support structures.
support_conical_min_width.enabled: support_conical_enabled and support_enable and support_structure != 'tree' and support_conical_angle > 0

magic_fuzzy_skin_enabled.label: Fuzzy Skin
magic_fuzzy_skin_enabled.description: Randomly jitter while printing the outer wall, so that the surface has a rough and fuzzy look.

magic_fuzzy_skin_outside_only.label: Fuzzy Skin Outside Only
magic_fuzzy_skin_outside_only.description: Jitter only the parts' outlines and not the parts' holes.

magic_fuzzy_skin_thickness.label: Fuzzy Skin Thickness
magic_fuzzy_skin_thickness.description: The width within which to jitter. It's advised to keep this below the outer wall width, since the inner walls are unaltered.

magic_fuzzy_skin_point_density.label: Fuzzy Skin Density
magic_fuzzy_skin_point_density.description: The average density of points introduced on each polygon in a layer. Note that the original points of the polygon are discarded, so a low density results in a reduction of the resolution.

magic_fuzzy_skin_point_dist.label: Fuzzy Skin Point Distance
magic_fuzzy_skin_point_dist.description: The average distance between the random points introduced on each line segment. Note that the original points of the polygon are discarded, so a high smoothness results in a reduction of the resolution. This value must be higher than half the Fuzzy Skin Thickness.

flow_rate_max_extrusion_offset.label: Flow Rate Compensation Max Extrusion Offset
flow_rate_max_extrusion_offset.description: The maximum distance in mm to move the filament to compensate for changes in flow rate.

flow_rate_extrusion_offset_factor.label: Flow Rate Compensation Factor
flow_rate_extrusion_offset_factor.description: How far to move the filament in order to compensate for changes in flow rate, as a percentage of how far the filament would move in one second of extrusion.

adaptive_layer_height_enabled.label: Use Adaptive Layers
adaptive_layer_height_enabled.description: Adaptive layers computes the layer heights depending on the shape of the model.

adaptive_layer_height_variation.label: Adaptive Layers Maximum Variation
adaptive_layer_height_variation.description: The maximum allowed height different from the base layer height.

adaptive_layer_height_variation_step.label: Adaptive Layers Variation Step Size
adaptive_layer_height_variation_step.description: The difference in height of the next layer height compared to the previous one.

adaptive_layer_height_threshold.label: Adaptive Layers Topography Size
adaptive_layer_height_threshold.description: Target horizontal distance between two adjacent layers. Reducing this setting causes thinner layers to be used to bring the edges of the layers closer together.

wall_overhang_angle.label: Overhanging Wall Angle
wall_overhang_angle.description: Walls that overhang more than this angle will be printed using overhanging wall settings. When the value is 90, no walls will be treated as overhanging. Overhang that gets supported by support will not be treated as overhang either. Furthermore, any line that's less than half overhanging will also not be treated as overhang.

cool_min_layer_time_overhang.label: Minimum Layer Time with Overhang
cool_min_layer_time_overhang.description: The minimum time spent in a layer that contains overhanging extrusions. This forces the printer to slow down, to at least spend the time set here in one layer. This allows the printed material to cool down properly before printing the next layer. Layers may still take shorter than the minimal layer time if Lift Head is disabled and if the Minimum Speed would otherwise be violated.

cool_min_layer_time_overhang_min_segment.label: Minimum Overhang Segment Length
cool_min_layer_time_overhang_min_segment.description: When trying to apply the minimum layer time specific for overhanging layers, it will be applied only if at least one consecutive overhanging extrusion move is longer than this value.

seam_overhang_angle.label: Seam Overhanging Wall Angle
seam_overhang_angle.description: Try to prevent seams on walls that overhang more than this angle. When the value is 90, no walls will be treated as overhanging.

wall_overhang_speed_factors.label: Overhanging Wall Speeds
